John,

thanks for the detailed response..It will take some time for me to 
digest...

not initializing the neurons in the net seems strange to me.  if you 
have a simple net of:

NODE1-->NODE2-->NODE3

1-->2 weight is .8

if NODE1 gets fired (the sensor on my agent keeps getting a reading 
from the world) at timestep one, you would add .8 to NODE2's inputs.

When you read NODE1 again, and if its active again, then you add .8 
again to get 1.6.

What if for 10 iterations NODE1 has an input?  Then you just keep 
adding to NODE2's value?  Or is what you are really saying is "don't 
reset values unless the neauton has fired, at which time it would be 
reset."?

--Kevin
